results.title: Schichlegruber - Doing the Lambeth Walk
results.brief_description: Schichlegruber - Doing the Lambeth Walk is a 1942 short propaganda film by Charles A. Ridley of the UK Ministry of Information. It consists of edited existing footage taken from Leni Riefenstahl’s Triumph of the Will.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

results.description:
Schichlegruber - Doing the Lambeth Walk is a 1942 short propaganda film by Charles A. Ridley of the UK Ministry of Information. It consists of edited existing footage taken from Leni Riefenstahl’s Triumph of the Will to make it appear as if they were dancing to the dance style The Lambeth Walk.

The film was distributed uncredited to newsreel companies.

  • Wikipedia

The film was distributed uncredited to newsreel companies.

results.title: Scandinavia: the rewards of excellence
results.brief_description: Describes similarities and differences in the geographic and cultural characteristics of Norway, Sweden and Denmark. Emphasises that skill, efficiency, and fine craftsmanship have enabled the Scandinavian people to make profitable use of meagre natural resources in developing an export trade and a high standard of living. Shows scenes of co-operative farming in Denmark, fishing off the coast of Norway, and manufacturing in Sweden.

results.title: Scabies headlice
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson, Nina Syme and Leigh Tilson and Associates
results.brief_description: The great Australian itch! These two films should be seen by everyone because like it or not, they are both afflictions that can affect anyone, regardless of class or social importance. If left untreated they can drive you around the twist. The two films are “Headlice: They can catch anyone” and “Scabies - The Unwelcome itch mite”.

results.title: Scabies
results.brief_description: Exposition of modern British methods used in diagnosis and treatment of scabies. The film shows the habits and life-cycle of the mite, the secondary infections which make diagnosis and treatment difficult, and methods of treatment. Treatment at a centre is shown, and instruction for home treatment are illustrated. Examination of contact is also dealt with. Intended for doctors, health visitors, sanitary inspectors, nurses and medical orderlies.

results.title: Saying no: a few words to young women about sex
results.creator_credit: Karen Crommie, David Crommie and Crommie and Crommie
results.brief_description: Aimed at adolescent girls this film shows them how to cope with demands made by boys or men for sexual relations when they do not wish to participate. Highlights some standard manipulative responses by males to females when they are denied sex and indicates how girls should go about handling such responses in an assertive manner.
